Takut Masalah dengan KPK, DPRD DKI Coret Anggaran Turap Rp 5 M Kali Ciasem
04 Nov 2019, 19:53 by Arief Ikhsanudin
Jakarta - Kepala Unit Pengelola Sampah Terpadu (UPST) Bantargebang Asep Kuswanto menganggarkan pembangunan turap di Kali Asem senilai Rp 5 miliar. Namun, usulan tersebut dicoret berdasarkan rapat yang digelar bersaa Komisi D DPRD DKI Jakarta.
Awalnya, Asep menjelaskan rencana pembangunan turap di Kali Ciasem senilai Rp 5 miliar saat rapat rencana KUA-PPAS 2020 dengan Komisi D. Kali tersebut memang melintasi kawasan Bantargebang.
"Jadi membangun turap, ada kali melintas di Bantargebang, tapi mulai longsor. Itu di dalam TPST Bantargebang," ucap Asep di Gedung DPRD DKI Jakarta, Jalan Kebon Sirih Jakarta Pusat, Senin (4/11/2019).
Mendengar rencana itu, Asisten Pembangunan DKI Yusmada Faizal mengatakan permasalahan kali adalah tanggung jawab dari pemerintah daerah setempat. Harus ada persetujuan dari Pemerintah Kota Bekasi jika TPST Bantargebang ingin membuat turap.
"Kalau kali alam itu biasanya dikuasai oleh pemda setempat. Ada mekanismenya itu. Bisa Pak, tapi harus ada perizinan, atau bantuan keuangan (kepada Bekasi)," kata Yusmada.

Afraid of Problems with the Corruption Eradication Commission, the DKI Regional Parliament (DPRD) Draws Out the Budget to Rp. 5 B in Ciasem River
Nov 04 2019, 19:53 by Arief Ikhsanudin
Jakarta - Head of the Integrated Waste Management Unit (UPST) Bantargebang Asep Kuswanto budgeted the construction of a sheet pile at Asem worth Rp 5 billion. However, the proposal was crossed out based on a meeting that was held in conjunction with Commission D DKI Jakarta DPRD.
Initially, Asep explained the plan to build a pile in Ciasem River worth Rp 5 billion during the KUA-PPAS 2020 plan meeting with Commission D. The river did indeed cross the Bantargebang area.
"So building plaster, there are times passing in Bantargebang, but began to landslides. That was in the Bantargebang TPST," Asep said in the DKI Jakarta DPRD Building, Jalan Kebon Sirih, Central Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019).
Hearing the plan, DKI Development Assistant Yusmada Faizal said the problem of the times was the responsibility of the local regional government. There must be approval from the Bekasi City Government if the Bantargebang TPST wants to make a sheet pile.
"At times the nature is usually controlled by the local government. There is a mechanism. It can, sir, but there must be a permit, or financial assistance (to Bekasi)," Yusmada said.
